Question.Info: How is problem formulation based on this phenomenon?

Answer.info: How is the effect of fishing tool on electrical conductivity of solution?
How is the effect of covalent compound type bond on electrical conductivity of solution?
How is the effect of solution type on the strength of electrical conductivity?
Why when electrocuted, fish in sea water die faster than fish in river?
How is the effect of substance form on electrical conductivity?

Question.Info: How do the hypotheses that correspond to problem formulation based on basic theory?

Answer.info: Fishing tool affects the electrical conductivity of solution
The type bond of covalent compound affects the electric conductivity of solution
When fishing by electrifying, fish in seawater die faster than fish in river
The type of solution affects the strength of solution electrical conductivity
The form of substance affects the electrical conductivity

Question.Info: The correct statement about electrolytes is ...

Answer.info: Substances which are dissolved in water remain molecules
Substances which are dissolved in water will break down into negative ions and positive ions
Substances which are dissolved in water will not break down into atoms
Substances which are dissolved in water will not break down into ions
Substances which are dissolved in water will break down into certain gases

Question.Info: When two substances (A and B) are dissolved in a water solvent then solutions A and B are tested using an electrolyte kit. Solution A can turn on the lamp and the pointer on avometer shows a scale of 1.1 V; while solution B can’t turn on the lamp and the pointer on avometer shows a scale of 0 V. This happens because ...

Answer.info: Solution A is not ionized and solution B is ionized completely
Solution A is ionized completely and solution B is not ionized
Solutions A and B are not ionized
Solutions A and B are ionized completely
Solutions A and B are ionized partially

Question.Info: A solid substance can’t conduct electricity whereas if the solid substance is dissolved in water, the solution can conduct electricity because ...

Answer.info: Water can conduct electricity
Water can be ionized if it contains solutes
The solid substance in water breaks down into molecules
Water provides an electric charge for solid substance
The solid substance in water breaks down into ions
